abstract: A multibillion-dollar contract for refueling tankers will be reopened after a report found flaws in the original process.
snippet: A multibillion-dollar contract for refueling tankers will be reopened after a report found flaws in the original process.
lead_paragraph: The Pentagon announced on Wednesday that it would reopen bidding on a $35 billion contract for midair refueling tankers, allowing Boeing to continue its effort to wrest the business from a partnership of Northrop Grumman and the European parent of its rival Airbus.

headline.main: Pentagon Gives Boeing New Chance at Contract
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Gives Boeing New Chance At Contract

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co
